html: The prophet exhorts those who inhabit places of resort, who are acclimated to dwelling in the wilderness, to assist people escaping destruction in Jehovah’s Day of Judgment and not let them perish. Jehovah desires to provide for those fleeing from the bared sword and drawn bow —from the king of Assyria/Babylon’s invasion of their lands—through the charity of others more fortunate than themselves whom he tests thereby. Besides Jehovah’s elect, many honorable people among the earth’s inhabitants, who “look to the forest home as protection” (Isaiah 22:8), too, may yet survive (Isaiah 66:18-19).
